The oplog in MongoDB is only used for restoring backups, not for replication.

MongoDB's aggregation pipeline only supports basic stages like $match and $sort.

Hashed indexes in MongoDB are used to perform full-text search and are not related to sharding.

All secondary nodes in a MongoDB replica set replicate data in real-time without delay.

The $geoNear stage in MongoDB's aggregation pipeline is used to index geospatial data, not for querying.

The $sample stage in MongoDB is used for sorting documents in a random order.

The $facet stage in MongoDB is used to split documents into different collections based on criteria.

The $unwind stage in MongoDB only flattens arrays and cannot preserve index information.

Collation in MongoDB is limited to sorting operations and cannot be applied to queries.

The $indexStats stage in MongoDB is used to create new indexes based on query patterns.

The $currentOp stage in MongoDB is used to kill long-running queries.

The $out stage in MongoDB is used to export data to external systems.

Sparse indexes in MongoDB include all documents, regardless of whether the indexed field contains a value.

Wildcard indexes in MongoDB are limited to static, well-defined fields in documents.

Shard balancing in MongoDB is an optional operation that has no impact on overall performance.

The $mergeObjects operator in MongoDB is used to merge collections, not document fields.

Retryable writes in MongoDB are designed to execute the same write operation multiple times for redundancy.

The $addFields stage in MongoDB is used to delete fields from documents in an aggregation pipeline.
MongoDB supports the use of encrypted fields within documents, allowing for field-level encryption.
Field-level encryption in MongoDB requires the entire document to be encrypted.
In a MongoDB replica set, the priority value assigned to each member affects the likelihood of that member becoming primary during an election.
The priority value in a MongoDB replica set only affects the order in which nodes are synced, not the election process.

The $map operator in MongoDB is used to filter array elements, not transform them.
MongoDB's $accumulator operator allows for custom aggregation logic by accumulating values during the processing of a group of documents.
The $accumulator operator in MongoDB is only used for predefined aggregation functions like $sum and $avg.
